section.title: Image Templates
section.para: How you can create your own image templates will be shown here.

section.title: Creating Your Own Image Templates
section.para: Create a subproject of your home project.

figure.title: Form for creating image template subproject

note.para: Published image templates are fetched via a project's attribute. Any package container living in a published project will be visible on the image templates page.

section.para: Within that project create a new package. That will be your actual image template.

Add the 'KIWI image build' repository to your project. This repository is needed to build KIWI images in your project. Go to the 'Repositories' tab, click on 'Add repositories' and chlick on the 'KIWI image build' checkbox.

figure.title: Enabling the kIWI image build repository

section.para: Add sources for your image configuration.

figure.title: Overview of sources of custom image template

section.para: KIWI configurations usually consists of an xml configuration root tarball.
For a full list of image descriptions and general information about building images with KIWI please refer to the KIWI project page and the KIWI cookbook.

section.title: Publishing Image Templates on the Official Image Templates Page
section.para: Once everything is set up and your templates are building, you might want to publish them. In that case contact the admin of the OBS instance you are using and ask them kindly to do so. If you happen to use the official OBS, that would be admin@opensuse.org.
